Environment

Class GameEnvironment

  • java.lang.Object
    • Environment.GameEnvironment

  • public class GameEnvironment
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class with the main method, that runs the game and calls the shots.
    Author:
    Benjamin Thurber, Blake Kayser

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void checkForGameOver()
      Checks if a condition is met to finish the game, either: All the crew are dead, the ship has been destroyed, the player has run out of days, or all the ship parts have been found.

      Closes Introduction window and calls launchTeamSelection()

      Takes a CrewMember and a task (a String) and makes the crew member perform that task.
      void gameOver()
      Calls initiateGameOver with no message
      void gameOver(java.lang.String message)
      Opens a new MessageBox with a message string (argument) followed by a blank line and the words "GAME OVER" (from variable GAME_OVER_MESSAGE)

      Called when "Visit space outpost" is clicked.

      • currentLocation

        public Location currentLocation
        The current location. Starts as a super class Location object which is empty space. currentLocation changes as you move to new Planets and SpaceOutposts.

        public void moveToNextPlanet()

        Called when "Start Next Day" is clicked. Begins a new day

        public void startFirstDay()
        Starts the first day of the game.

      • executeCrewMemberAction

        public void executeCrewMemberAction(CrewMember member,
                                    java.lang.String task)
        Takes a CrewMember and a task (a String) and makes the crew member perform that task. Called when go button is pressed.
        Parameters:
        member - the CrewMember to execute the action on
        task - String that is the action

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Main Function that runs the game. Creates an object of GameEnvironment and launches the Introduction window.
        Parameters:
        args - runtime args

      • getTotalDays

        public int getTotalDays()
        Gets the total number of days remaining
        Returns:
        int number of days

      • setDays

        public void setDays(int days)
        Sets total and remaining days and the number of ship parts to be found (2/3 * Days)
        Parameters:
        days - input days to set

        public int getCurrentDay()
        Returns:
        the current day

        public int getShipPartsTotalMissing()
        Returns:
        total number of ship parts missing

      • setShipParts

        public void setShipParts(int shipPartsTotal)
        Parameters:
        shipPartsTotal - the total number of parts

      • checkForGameOver

        public void checkForGameOver()
        Checks if a condition is met to finish the game, either: All the crew are dead, the ship has been destroyed, the player has run out of days, or all the ship parts have been found. A game over could constitute a win as well as a lose.

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver(java.lang.String message)
        Opens a new MessageBox with a message string (argument) followed by a blank line and the words "GAME OVER" (from variable GAME_OVER_MESSAGE)
        Parameters:
        message - String of the message to display on the message box

      • gameOver

        public void gameOver()
        Calls initiateGameOver with no message
